basics.name: adminUsername
basics.label: VM Admin User Name
basics.toolTip: The name of the Admin User for initial SSH access to all OCP Nodes.

label.sshPublicKey: SSH Public Key for VM Admin User

toolTip.sshPublicKey: SSH Public Key for the VM Admin User. Corresponds to the Private Key in the Key Vault that was configured as part of the pre-work.

elements.name: openshiftClusterPrefix
elements.label: OCP Cluster Name Prefix
elements.toolTip: The Prefix for the name of the OCP Nodes. Must be between 1 and 20 characters.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-20 characters long.

elements.name: keyVaultResourceGroup
elements.label: Key Vault Resource Group Name
elements.toolTip: Name of the Resource Group that contains the Key Vault used to store the Private Key.

elements.name: keyVaultName
elements.label: Key Vault Name
elements.toolTip: Name of the Key Vault that contains the Secret used to store the Private Key.

elements.name: keyVaultSecret
elements.label: Secret Name
elements.toolTip: Name of the Secret that contains the Private Key.

elements.name: openshiftPassword
elements.toolTip: Password for the OpenShift Admin User - not the VM Admin User.

elements.name: rhsmUsername
elements.label: Red Hat Subscription Manager User Name
elements.toolTip: User Name to access your Red Hat Subscription - access.redhat.com. This is used to register the RHEL instance to your subscription and will not be stored by Microsoft or Red Hat.

elements.name: rhsmPassword

label.password: Red Hat Subscription Manager User Password

elements.toolTip: Password to access your Red Hat Subscription - access.redhat.com. This is used to register the RHEL instance to your subscription and will not be stored by Microsoft or Red Hat.

elements.name: rhsmPoolId
elements.label: Red Hat Subscription Manager Pool ID
elements.toolTip: The Pool ID that contains OpenShift Container Platform entitlement. Ensure you have enough entitlements of OpenShift Container Platform for the installation of the cluster.

elements.name: enableAzure
elements.label: Configure Azure Cloud Provider
elements.toolTip: Configure OpenShift to use Azure Cloud Provider. Necessary if using Azure disk attach for persistent volumes.

allowedValues.label: Yes
No
